direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with attribute handling but one checks for the presence and the other retrieves the value.
Both methods handle attribute retrieval, but 'eachAttr' collects values from all elements while 'attr' returns the first match.
Both methods interact with element attributes, but one removes the attribute while the other retrieves it.
Both methods modify element attributes, but one deals with class attributes while the other deals with general attributes.
Both methods modify element attributes, but one removes class attributes while the other deals with general attributes.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements with attributes is a prerequisite for testing attribute-related methods.
Setting up the environment with necessary elements and attributes is required before testing attribute retrieval.
Verifying the presence and correctness of attributes is crucial for asserting the results of attribute retrieval methods.
